page.title: 04Diet and Health
page.content: Buying food and eating habits have changed a lot.Our results show that 57% buy in supermarkets,15% in separate shops.Average prices in supermarkets today and how they would be in 50 years,inflation taken at 5% per annum are shown below: Brown bread 44p,Â£4.81 Sugar 47p,Â£5.38 1lb Apples 62p,Â£7.10 Chicken 72p Â£8.25 pint Milk 21p,Â£2.40 6 Eggs 50p,Â£5.73 Tea Â£1.15,Â£13.18. Convenience foods are eaten by 15% population,60% eat fresh.A vegetarian diet adhered to by 5% population.We noticed a marked increase in convenience foods but a large percentage of the population still eat healthily probably in response to publicity persuading people to look after their bodies and to eat healthy foods.
